definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
right in front of sb's eyes/right under sb's nose/current/at the moment

sentences.english: They were embezzling funds right under his nose.
sentences.chinese: 他們就在他眼皮子底下把公款貪污了。

sentences.english: The answer was right under our noses the whole time.
sentences.chinese: 答案一直就在我們眼皮子底下。

sentences.english: The two thieves stole the paintings and took them out just under the guards' noses.
sentences.chinese: 那兩個竊賊偷了畫，就在警衛的眼皮子底下拿了出去。

definition: in front of one's eyes/in full view as a panorama/right now
eyeball/fig. the apple of one's eye (i.e. favorite person)
to lift/to raise/(of two or more persons) to carry
calf (back of the leg below the knee)
to roll rapidly/to spin/Taiwan pr. [gu2 lu5]
to narrow one's eyes/to squint/(dialect) to take a nap
